intro: Megarrhiza marah, commonly known as the desert orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, intricate flower structure. The plant has a short, tubular stem and produces showy, fragrant blooms that are typically pink or purple in color. Its roots are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Megarrhiza marah plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
